{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents suggest that denture base resins are a type of pour resin. Construction of denture bases from pour resins discusses the problems of porosity, voids, and heavy anterior tooth contact resulting from shrinkage of the resin during curing. This information implies that if the flasks are not properly closed during packing, it could lead to porosity or voids in the final product. Porosity or voids would likely result in an increase in vertical dimension.", "answer_choice": "C"}
